name: Cook the Book: Hani Slow-Baked Pork Jerky
description: Photograph from adactio on Flickr My favorite jerky memory is of the teriyaki beef jerky you can pick up at the airport in Anchorage, Alaska. My mom always bought bags of it without fail on our layovers at 3...
recipeYield: 6 as a main course, 8 to 10 as an appetizer
recipeIngredient: About 2 pounds boneless pork butt, fresh ham, or other pork roast
About 2 teaspoons freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Place a rack in the upper third of the oven and preheat the oven to 350°F.
Slice the meat against the grain into slices 1/4 inch thick or less. Lay on one or two broiling pans, stretching the slices to make them even thinner. Sprinkle on the salt and black pepper.
Bake for 1 hour, turning the pieces of meat every 20 minutes or so. The pork will become light, like jerky; it should be a little chewy and completely dried out.
